content: the wine list is extensive and can easily hike up an otherwise reasonably priced meal.
the tables are crammed way too close, the menu is typical of any italian restaurant, and the wine list is simply overpriced.

good food at the restaurant (a bit expensive, but great if you want to impress your date).

the food looked very appetizing and delicious since it came on a variety of fancy plates.
the food is uniformly exceptional, with a very capable kitchen which will proudly whip up whatever you feel like eating, whether it's on the menu or not.

where tanks in other chinatown restaurants display a lurking myriad of sad-looking marine life in their murky waters, the tanks at ping's are clear as glass with healthy-looking creatures who do not yet know that they will be part of some dim sum lover's brunch .
so much more than the usual bar food, go there to enjoy the menu while sampling one of their hand-crafted beers .
its a go-to for dates as well as entertaining out of town guests.

for many people, this may not seem like aunthentic thai food because most places in nyc arent quite authentic.
the seafood is amazing, there's a good wine list, and the ever-changing menu always offers some great surprises.
night without a reservation , we had to wait at the bar for a little while, but the manager was so nice and made our wait a great experience.
no dress codes, no attitudes, plenty of comfort companionship, a great place to relax in an always busy midtown.

there is actually space to breathe and the decor sets the tone for an intimate dinner.

my picks are:  - scallion pancake (fried with vegetable juice, very special and tasty)  - guizhou chicken  - shredded squid family style (one of my personal favorites)  - sichuan spicy soft shell crab  - shuizhu fish (this one is for hardcore sichuan food fans, i wouldn't recommend to my american friends as it's very spicy.
the big complaint: no toasting available.

the worst excuse for japanese food i've ever encountered.
the signs, the specials menus, food , and even all the waitstaff are all totally japanese.

the place is small and intimate and you may feel a little crowded, but the service is excellent and it's great for friends out, a romantic date, or a special occassion.

the large selection of bruschettas , paninis, tramezzinis keep the palate from stagnating.

$160 for 2 filets , 2 sides, an appetizer and drinks.

acceptable prices .

content: the menu looked good, except for offering the chilean sea bass, but the server does not offer up the specials that were written on the board outside.
after we got our sashimi order, i could not believe how small the portions were!
also, the sandwiches (nearing $7) didn't come with anything like chips or a side.
the mussaman curry that i ordered was as thin as water and aside from the poorly fried tofu that i ordered in it, they graciously provided me with one piece of poorly cooked potato .
we shared a bottle of sake, an order of edamames, and she had the sushi plate while i had the sashimi.
the portions are small but being that the food was so good makes up for that.
friendly staff that actually lets you enjoy your meal and the company you're with.
overall, the ingredients and technique are there and i am encouraged enough to return at lunch or dinner to see whether the boldness of the flavour palette improves.
the food arrived 20 minutes after i called, cold and soggy.

fluke sashimi drizzled with jalapeno-lime olive oil , the fruit of the oil nicely highlighting the fish's sweetness.

(food was delivered by a busboy , not waiter) we got no cheese offered for the pasta, our water and wine glasses remained empty our entire meal, when we would have easily spent another $20 on wine.

i must warn the reader that the portions sizes are very small (especially the appetizers), so if you plan to eat until you are full and do not intend to order the chef's special tasting menu, prepare to order and pay for an appetizer (1 dish for each person because the portions are not for sharing), a main entree, and the cold udon at the end of the meal.

the food is amazing!!!!

while this isn't classical restaurant fare, the chef has given new life to an old cuisine with some really innovative and tasty dishes that are genuinely indian without being heavy or same old restaurant burn-outs.
